metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: Probability
Probability is about how Likely something is to occur, or how likely something is true.
content.html: Probability is about how Likely something is to occur, or how likely something is true.

content.text: The mathematic probability is a Number between 0 and 1 .
content.html: The mathematic probability is a Number between 0 and 1.

content.text: 0 indicates Impossibility and 1 indicates Certainty .
content.html: 0 indicates Impossibility and 1 indicates Certainty.

content.text: The Probability of an Event
The probability of an event is:
content.html: The probability of an event is:

content.text: The number of ways the event can happen / The number of possible outcomes.
content.html: The number of ways the event can happen / The number of possible outcomes.

content.text: Probability = # of Ways / Outcomes
content.html: Probability = # of Ways / Outcomes

content.text: Tossing Coins
When tossing a coin, there are two possible outcomes:
content.html: When tossing a coin, there are two possible outcomes:

content.text: P(A) - The Probability
The probability of an event A is often written as P(A) .
content.html: The probability of an event A is often written as P(A).

content.text: When tossing two coins, there are 4 possible outcomes:
content.html: When tossing two coins, there are 4 possible outcomes:

content.text: Throwing Dices
When throwing a dice, there are 6 possible outcomes:
content.html: When throwing a dice, there are 6 possible outcomes:

content.text: The possibility of throwing 3 fours at the same time is (1/6) 3 (Lands on 4 to the power of 3):
content.html:
The possibility of throwing 3 fours at the same time is
(1/6)3 (Lands on 4 to the power of 3):

content.code_html: let p = Math.pow(1/6, 3);

content.text: The possibility of throwing 3 likes at the same time is 6 times larger: (lands on 1) + (Lands on 2) + ... + (Lands on 6)
content.html:
The possibility of throwing 3 likes at the same time is 6 times larger:
(lands on 1) + (Lands on 2) + ... + (Lands on 6)

content.code_html: let p = Math.pow(1/6, 3) * 6;

content.text: 6 Balls
I have 6 balls in a bag: 3 reds, 2 are green, and 1 is blue.
content.html: I have 6 balls in a bag: 3 reds, 2 are green, and 1 is blue.

content.text: Blindfolded. What is the probability that I pick a green one?
content.html: Blindfolded. What is the probability that I pick a green one?

content.text: Number of Ways it can happen are 2 (there are 2 greens).
content.html: Number of Ways it can happen are 2 (there are 2 greens).

content.text: Number of Outcomes are 6 (there are 6 balls).
content.html: Number of Outcomes are 6 (there are 6 balls).

content.text: Probability = Ways / Outcomes
content.html: Probability = Ways / Outcomes

content.text: The probability that I pick a green one is 2 out of 6: 2/6 = 0.333333.
content.html: The probability that I pick a green one is 2 out of 6: 2/6 = 0.333333.

content.text: The probability is written P(green) = 0.333333.
content.html: The probability is written P(green) = 0.333333.

content.text: P(A) = P(B)
For the 6 balls:
content.html: For the 6 balls:

content.text: Choosing a King
The probability of choosing a king in a deck of cards is 4 in 52.
content.html: The probability of choosing a king in a deck of cards is 4 in 52.

content.text: Number of Ways it can happen are 4 (there are 4 kings).
content.html: Number of Ways it can happen are 4 (there are 4 kings).

content.text: Number of Outcomes are 52 (there are 52 cards).
content.html: Number of Outcomes are 52 (there are 52 cards).

content.text: Probability = Ways / Outcomes
content.html: Probability = Ways / Outcomes

content.text: The probability is 4 out of 52: 4/52 = 0.076923.
content.html: The probability is 4 out of 52: 4/52 = 0.076923.

content.text: The probability is written P(king) = 0.076923.
content.html: The probability is written P(king) = 0.076923.
